Statement-1 : The value of the integral 

$$\int\limits_{\pi /6}^{\pi /3} {{{dx} \over {1 + \sqrt {\tan \,x} }}} $$ is equal to $$\pi /6$$
Statement-2 : $$\int\limits_a^b {f\left( x \right)} dx = \int\limits_a^b {f\left( {a + b - x} \right)} dx.$$

option_texts.A: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true; Statement-2 is a correct explanation for Statement-1.
option_texts.B: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true; Statement-2 is not a correct explanation for Statement-1.
option_texts.C: Statement- 1 is true; Statement-2 is False.
option_texts.D: Statement-1 is false; Statement-2 is true.

option_texts.A: Statement - $${\rm I}$$ is true, Statement - $${\rm II}$$ is true, Statement - $${\rm II}$$ is the correct explanation of statement - $${\rm I}$$.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
This question has statement $${\rm I}$$ and statement $${\rm I}$$$${\rm I}$$. Of the four choices given after the statements, choose the one that best describes the two statements.
Statement - $${\rm I}$$: A point particle of mass $$m$$ moving with speed $$\upsilon $$ collides with stationary point particle of mass $$M.$$ If the maximum energy loss possible is given as $$f\left( {{1 \over 2}m{v^2}} \right)$$, then $$f = \left( {{m \over {M + m}}} \right).$$


Statement - $${\rm II}$$: Maximum energy loss occurs when the particles get stuck together as a result of the collision.

option_texts.A: Statement - $${\rm I}$$ is true, Statement - $${\rm II}$$ is true; Statement - $${\rm II}$$ is the correct explanation of Statement - $${\rm I}$$.
option_texts.B: Statement - $${\rm I}$$ is true, Statement - $${\rm II}$$ is true; Statement - $${\rm II}$$ is not the correct explanation of Statement - $${\rm I}$$.
option_texts.C: Statement - $${\rm I}$$ is true, Statement - $${\rm II}$$ is false
option_texts.D: Statement - $${\rm I}$$ is false, Statement - $${\rm II}$$ true.
